meanings.definition: To move to a new position.
meanings.sent1: She repositioned the vase on the table.
meanings.sent2: The nurse repositioned the patient in bed.
meanings.sent3: The cat repositioned the toy mouse for a surprise attack.
meanings.sent4: The sun repositioned itself behind the clouds.
meanings.sent5: He repositioned the mirror to get a better view.

meanings.definition: To change the position of something.
meanings.sent1: He repositioned the books on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The artist repositioned the painting on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The robot repositioned the misplaced screw with precision.
meanings.sent4: The wind repositioned the fallen leaves across the yard.
meanings.sent5: She repositioned the furniture to create more space.
